avalancheActivity.comment: Snow was heavier in the mountains with a strong southerly wind. The new fallen snow has put additional stress on the weak layers in the old snow cover. Places with blown snow and shady areas where there is a weak layer deep in the snowpack are more dangerous. In particular, at low loads, medium-sized avalanches of packed snow will be possible. A major Avalanche cannot be ruled out. Below 1700 m, gliding avalanches will be possible, especially on steep grassy slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New fallen snow has not adhered well to the old snow base

bulletins.highlights: The current snowpack pattern is uncommon and requires special attention and caution!

snowpackStructure.comment: It snowed on Wednesday and Thursday, with moderate to strong southerly winds at first, which built up in large areas. In total, 20 to 50 cm of snow fell. In the central mountains, snow fell first quite wet and then increasingly dry.  Deep and persistent weak layers are present in the old snow cover. The snowpack is unstable in many places.

tendency.highlights: It will clear in the high alpine regions, while clouds will remain at lower altitudes. It will be cooler. The danger of avalanches will remain similar.

weatherForecast.comment: Friday is pointing to dry weather. It will clear during the day, with faster winds in the high alpine regions. In the mid mountains, there will remain a lot of low cloud, with peaks in fog. There will be only light westerly winds. Temperatures will be around -2 at 1500 m and -8 °C at 2500 m.

bulletins.highlights: The current snowpack pattern is uncommon and requires special attention and caution!

snowpackStructure.comment: It snowed on Wednesday and Thursday, with moderate to strong southerly winds at first, which built up in large areas. In total, 10 to 30 cm of snow fell. In the central mountains, snow fell first quite wet and then increasingly dry.  Deep and persistent weak layers are present in the old snow cover. The snowpack is unstable in many places.

tendency.highlights: It will clear in the high alpine regions, while clouds will remain at lower altitudes. It will be cooler. The danger of Avalanches will remain similar.
